name: Great Northern Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I have just returned from another great weekend at The Great Northern. We take a few breaks in the year and love going to the hotel because
reviews.title: another great weekend
Another great stay
reviews.text: 1 the staff are friendly and helpful giving excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 2 the rooms are clean
reviews.title: Run, Run Away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: 3 the food is good with brilliant service from the restaurant staff even when the hotel is fully booked
reviews.title: Still great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: 4 there is a lovely leisure centre
reviews.title: Needs a Big Revamp

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there one night on a bus tour and I would not stay again or recommend it based on the room. From the start of getting into the room which was a challenge to get the door unlocked. Once unlocked the hinges needed to be oiled as the door had a contiuouses creak. The toilet seat should have been replaced as when it was lifted the underneath was yellow and looked bubbly. The curtains were hanging off the clips on one side making the room tacky. The bedspreads looked like they could have been updated. I realize not everyone could have a view but considering the room was lacking no view just added to the experience.
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was good the service and the meals was great and the rest of the hotel was clean.
reviews.title: My wedding day 25th August 2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I got married in Bundoran an had my reception in the Great Northern Hotel, From start to finish they couldnt do enough for us, having travelled from armagh we had a few runs to do with dresses, cake and so on and the hotel let us leave as much stuff as we wanted there in our own room which was a great help as theres enough pressure. I stayed in the hotel the night before the wedding with my family an my bridesmaids, as it was to far to travel from armagh that morning as i had a 7 week old baby at the time and all i can say is it was definately a great second home, the staff were so helpfull from checking the rooms was ok for me, and if i wanted food drink anything atall dnt be afraid to phone reception and they even calmed my nerves, so much so that on my wedding day all the nerves were gone lol. The wedding day itself we were made to feel like royalty the hotel was done up lovely, the room we had the view of the sea the layout of the tables seat covers everything was great, and as for the food and the service i dn't no were to begin just absolutely excellent from start to finish. I would just like to thank the Great Northern for all the effort they put in to making my Big day special I couldn't have asked for any better and appreciate it so much and would like to mention a special thankyou to all the staff especially Karen mc Eniff who helped us out from start to finish. so thanks again from Danielle, Paddy and baby Lucy Lennon will see yous all soon :) xx
reviews.title: Cant wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I had an AMAZING break away. I was so worried reading the mixed reviews on the hotel but decided I had to see for myself and my god I am glad I did... it is a fine hotel, I was greeted by friendly receptionists that made me feel so welcome. The food was magnificent in the dining room and the staff where exceptional at there jobs
reviews.title: Wee daniel and the shining

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: I personally don’t no were all the bad reviews are coming from. I understand its an old hotel but that’s what brings me to it, if your looking for a modern hotel that have them new marble floors that you don’t get any warmth out of go to another hotel because here... it has a real comforting homely feeling to it and unbelievable views, the lobby is so comfortable I sat there everyday looking out over the cliffs
reviews.title: A tradiptional hotel with traditional values

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Just stayed for two nights in a Wainscott room on the top floor. This was a business trip for me, and I would return but keeping a few things in mind...
reviews.title: Very good, with some opportunities...
Awesome location
reviews.text: Staff: All very courteous, helpful, and with positive attitudes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room: My Wainscott room was similar to the web site photo, although there was no desk rather a small kidney-shaped side table and chair in a corner. This had no nearby light, and no nearby power, so not really practical for more than a quick email check. (The cord on the nightstand lamp was not long enough to stretch over to the table, nor was the sloping ceiling high enough to make it practical.) For this trip, I was not working from my room, so this was not a big challenge. Were I to have needed to work there, I'd have had to relocate to the business centre. The bed was quite comfortable for me, with good linens/duvet/pillows. (Understand this is subjective, but I like the down fill.) Note that there is a USB phone charging point near the nightstand, but no conventional power plug there - took me awhile to notice that option. The TV is a Lowe, with superb HD picture quality and a good variety of channels. The free WiFi worked perfectly for me for simple internet - I didn't do any big downloads.
reviews.title: Brilliant bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013
reviews.text: I liked the quality of carpets/wood panels/large decorative mirror. The soundproofing on the windows (two double-glazed layers) plus wooden shutters kept city noise far away. The plum coloured walls were very rich and elegant, however I think in the room where I stayed (504) it would have been better to have the high flat part of the ceiling painted white v/s the same dark plum as the walls. The room did seem to have dark areas at night, even with all available lights on. Likely in part due to the sloped ceiling.
reviews.title: Great location, hard beds, re-kindled my love for wagon wheels...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was comfortable size, with a large walk-in shower cubicle which offered a very high (7-foot) "rainforest" shower head, plus a good hand-shower option. Good lighting, quality toiletries, and plenty of towels. There were also robe hooks and suitable hanging space for towels, which was really good. Bathrobes provided in the room.
reviews.title: Luxury gem in a super location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Reservations staff was wonderful before our visit however hotel was NOT like described on the website. Old in appearance and furnishings in the rooms. Bed was comfortable; room was quiet. Biggest disappointment was the lack of views from VERY small windows in rooms and odd room floor plans (in one of the rooms for our group the outer wall was nearly entirely taken by the bathroom, making the "living" space of the room rather dark). Certainly not a quaint B&B but also not a fancy upscale hotel as the website might imply. Despite the beautiful sunset, ocean and mountains in the distance, Bundoran town was also a disappointment - certainly not worth a second trip.
reviews.title: Big, OLD, hotel … beautiful scenic local with NO views from the rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: My overall stay was excellent. A beautiful birthday treat. The welcome was excellent, with very friendly reception staff. My hubby and I arrived at the hotel after 8 pm. On asking if we were in time for a meal, was advised that last orders was at eight. Receptionist rang through to kitchen and they advised that they were happy to accommodate us. The three course meal was sublime. Out room was oldy worldy perfect. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. All staff were very polite and respectful. Would I stay here again, yes I would.
reviews.title: Another World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have spent a 3 night break in the Great Northern and cannot understand all the previous negative reviews of this hotel. The room, breakfast, evening meal and food in the bar were of high quality. Staff were friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Break in Great Northern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only negative review i would have is that the lift is a little outdated.
reviews.title: never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I did not make use of the leisure facilities but i plan to on my next visit to the Great Northern Hotel.
reviews.title: Peeling wallpaper. Do not stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The website showed that we were in for a treat..!! I'm a sucker!! The rooms shown were beautiful. on our approach the Hotel looked beautiful and the reception staff were very nice. We arrived early and had to hang about for a few hours until the 4pm (how late??) check in.
reviews.title: Should have checked Trip advisor! Doesn't do what it says on the tin!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We relaxed in the bar, had a few drinks, sat out in the sun, very pleasant!
reviews.title: Dont waste your money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well upon receiving our key and after searching and searching for our room I near passed out. it was dark shoved away under the eaves and packed solid with as many beds as they could fit into it. The view was out over the back roof. I went straight to reception and asked for the room I thought I had booked which was shown on the website. the receptionists were not happy and told me that we did get the room we booked. I explained over and over that I booked the hotel as I saw it advertised on the website and would like that room. they said after a length of time that there were none available and I could look at another few rooms to see if i would prefer them. I was accompanied to 2 more rooms by a very unhappy receptionist and shown 2 more of the same standard rooms. I choose what seemed to be the best of a bad bunch.. see attached photos..... our view was just as bad. but we decided to make the best of it. we had a great day in Bundoran - the hills of Donegal festival was on and we passed a good few hours.
reviews.title: Website pictures do not live up to expectations
Interesting Hotel
reviews.text: back in the hotel the worst 2 piece EVER were playing and the youngest guest was about 65!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: that aside we passed the night and got up the next morning for a good walk and then breakfast. Well i can assure you, you dare not enjoy yourself in the restaurant, the lady Maitre D was extremely unpleasant and we were under no doubt that she wasn't happy about something... or maybe that's just her sunny disposition!!
reviews.title: Great few days

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stylish hotel in a great location. We were passing through London for one night and needed to be close to Kings X and St Pancras. Check in was a breeze and the lovely young man showed us to our room where he also introduced us to the pantry. Such a delightful idea! The hotel is new and finished well. We had one of the larger rooms and was blissfully quiet. We will definitely be back
reviews.title: Gorgeous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having watched them rebuild this place when I lived in London I thought it would be great to stay & see the finished product. The hotel has been beautifully refurbished to a very high standard. We booked on lastminute.com & booked a room with a queen bed for £219 We also requested no feathers in pillows & duvet due to allergies.
reviews.title: Tiny rooms. Unfortunately not as good as expected.
A very pleasant surprise
reviews.text: On arrival the staff at reception were friendly & showed us to our room. The corridor outside our room was huge so I was surprised when we opened the door at how small our room was. It had a small, but nicely done ensuite & small wardrobe. There was just room to stand at my husband's side of the bed but my side was pushed right up against the wall. At the end of the bed, the distance of about 1 and half feet was filled in with a buttoned seat so you couldn't get round the end of the bed either( it reminded me of sleeping in the caravan!). Directly above this seat on the wall was the tv. Out of our window, down below I could see right through the glass roof of kings cross station to the people waiting for trains. I couldn't hear any noise from the station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After sitting on our bed for a while my husband started to get tight chested & we realised they hadn't removed the feather bedding. We rang reception & about 30 minutes later a lady from housekeeping came to change it. This lady argued with us that this bedding was the best for allergies & we told her my husband is allergic to feathers. She wouldn't have it & kept insisting to the point when I told her to stop arguing with the customer. I am sure she thought we were being unreasonable for asking it to be changed. She certainly didn't seem very happy about having to do it. She then told us when we book next time we should mention it! We both replied in unison ' we did!'
reviews.title: Stylish Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After she had left I realised our bed was only a four foot six when we should have a queen, my husband went down to reception & showed them our paperwork & they said the price we had paid was only for this size bed. We insisted we wanted moving as our paperwork clearly showed we had booked a queen. ( if we thought it was going to be a double we wouldn't have booked) they finally moved us to the 5 th floor, even though they told us they couldn't as they were full!
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night because of proximity to Kings Cross Station. The design was interesting, staff helpful and 'quirky' but professional, and there were lots of nice touches such as the larder with free tea, coffee, cakes and newspapers, free wifi, etc. DIning room was lovely for breakfast and the kippers I had were the best for a long time.
reviews.title: Great location, interesting hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed at both the St Pancras and the Pullman up the road on several occasions - we love this area - we were looking forward to staying at the Great Northern having watched it emerge from the building site that surrounds the station. We weren't disappointed. The room was small but the double aspect windows framing Kings Cross on one side and the majestic clock tower of the St Pancras to the other, made up for it.
reviews.title: Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was comfy and the linens excellent quality. We opted for a room with a bath rather than a shower and it was bliss. Huge and deep with lots of big fluffy towels. Ok, there's very little hanging space so if you stayed for several nights that would be a pain. And if you prefer tea to coffee it means a trip up the corridor to the pantry (nice touch and the jelly babies yummy). We thought it might be noisy but the windows are well glazed and it was very quiet. We didn't eat at the hotel but wandering through the stylish bar at around 11pm, it was buzzing and we will definitely pop back one evening for a cocktail or two. Definitely recommended and good value for money.
reviews.title: Fantastic GNH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Searched on line and found this hotel by accident. Dropped on as the Kings cross opening weekend, which was a lovely surprise. The station and area has had a massive much needed face lift. The hotel stands proudly between the stations, great location for transport links. The staff were attentive and friendly. Staff showed us to the room, and explained all the gadgets and the complete sound proof windows. The room was lovely, with fantastic linen, towels, toiletries and furnishings. The pantry is a lovely touch for coffee lovers.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only slight downside is that the price is room only, no breakfast provided.
reviews.title: Oh Dear, Not Great Northern
Convenient, Different, Slightly Disappointing
reviews.text: Nice friendly staff, helpful. Very convenient if you're arriving late or leaving early from St Pancras or Kings Cross.

reviews.title: Our favourite hotel in London!
reviews.text: Rooms tiny, although free movies etc make up for this - fine if you just need somewhere to get your head down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bar busy, but good service.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Overall, good, but not great.
reviews.title: only for one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and i stayed at The Great Northern and found the whole experience amazing!
reviews.title: Fur Coat and Nae Knickers

description: This luxury hotel in Bundoran Co Donegal is located on an 18 hole championship golf course and boasts a beautiful Leisure & Conference Centre. After your meal you can enjoy a relaxing drink in our lounge bars or dance the night away in our Atlantic Ballroom. Enjoy the charms of our Tir-Chonail Dining Room open daily with a full dinner menu on offer.
